intro: Geniostoma antherotrichum var. antherotrichum, commonly known as the hairy antherotrichum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its vibrant floral display.
